#summary Accord.Math namespace

 _This page is about the Mathematics module of Accord.NET. For general descriptions on Mathematics, please see [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Math Mathematics (Wikipedia)]._

= Accord.Math =

The Accord.Math namespace contains support classes for almost all other modules in the framework. It features a matrix extension library, alongside a suite of numerical matrix decomposition methods, numerical optimization algorithms for constrained and unconstrained problems, special functions and other tools for scientific applications. 

== Matrices ==

Importing the Accord.Math namespace automatically brings support for the Extension Matrix Library, which extends common .NET datatypes with several mathematics-related extension methods.

<p align="center">
http://accord.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/samples/accord-math-matrixoperations-img.png
</p>

== Decompositions ==

The framework comes with a wide range of numerical [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matrix_decomposition matrix decompositions], which dedicated versions for different .NET datatypes. Those decompositions can be used to solve linear system, compute matrix inverses and pseudo-inverses and extract other useful information about the decomposed matrices.

== Optimization ==

The Accord.Math.Optimization namespace contains classes for constrained and unconstrained optimization. Includes, for example, the [http://accord.googlecode.com/svn/docs/html/T_Accord_Math_Optimization_ConjugateGradient.htm Conjugate Gradient] (CG) and the [http://accord.googlecode.com/svn/docs/html/T_Accord_Math_Optimization_BroydenFletcherGoldfarbShanno.htm Broyden–Fletcher–Goldfarb–Shanno] (BFGS) methods for unconstrained optimization; the [http://accord.googlecode.com/svn/docs/html/T_Accord_Math_Optimization_GoldfarbIdnaniQuadraticSolver.htm Goldfarb-Idnani] solver for Quadratic Programming (QP) problems and the [http://accord.googlecode.com/svn/docs/html/T_Accord_Math_Optimization_AugmentedLagrangianSolver.htm Augmented Lagrangian] method for nonlinear optimization.

Also contains methods for univariate search, such as [http://accord.googlecode.com/svn/docs/html/T_Accord_Math_Optimization_BrentSearch.htm Brent's method] for finding function roots, maximum or minimum values of an univariate function. 

== Wavelets ==

Wavelet transform classes, such as the 1D and 2D [http://accord.googlecode.com/svn/docs/html/T_Accord_Math_Wavelets_CDF97.htm Cohen-Daubechies-Feauveau] and [http://accord.googlecode.com/svn/docs/html/T_Accord_Math_Wavelets_Haar.htm Haar Wavelet] transforms.

== Special functions == 

Complete sets of special functions, such as factorials, log-factorials, combinatorics and more specialized functions, such as the [http://accord.googlecode.com/svn/docs/html/AllMembers_T_Accord_Math_Bessel.htm Bessel], [http://accord.googlecode.com/svn/docs/html/AllMembers_T_Accord_Math_Gamma.htm Gamma], [http://accord.googlecode.com/svn/docs/html/AllMembers_T_Accord_Math_Beta.htm Beta] and [http://accord.googlecode.com/svn/docs/html/AllMembers_T_Accord_Math_Normal.htm Normal (Gaussian)] functions. 

== Parsing == 

Contains methods and classes to [http://accord.googlecode.com/svn/docs/html/N_Accord_Math_Formats.htm convert to and from various matrix formats], such as the formats used by .NET (e.g. [http://accord.googlecode.com/svn/docs/html/T_Accord_Math_Formats_CSharpMatrixFormatProvider.htm multidimensional] and [http://accord.googlecode.com/svn/docs/html/T_Accord_Math_Formats_CSharpJaggedMatrixFormatProvider.htm jagged] C# matrices) and [http://accord.googlecode.com/svn/docs/html/T_Accord_Math_Formats_OctaveMatrixFormatProvider.htm Octave].

== And many more ==

There are much more in the framework than the classes presented here. For a full description of the Accord.Math namespace, please take a look on the [http://accord.googlecode.com/svn/docs/Index.html namespace documentation].
